attributes.action: Pay Increase, better staff facilities and free car parking for all NHS staff
attributes.additional_details: The world is in a global pandemic, our NHS healthcare system is doing everything in there power to help keep us safe and fight the horrid Covid-19 virus that is sadly taking lives of the public and NHS staff, clapping for our hero's every Thursday is a nice gesture but way more needs to be done for our NHS Staff that are risking there lives everyday to keep us safe. they are doing there best the NHS Is fantastic before the pandemic and we are very lucky to have it, the government need to do more.
attributes.background: The government needs to review all NHS Staff pay across the board and increase all there salaries, NHS Staff also need better facilities to sit down and rest in comfort. Free car parking Facilities need to be provided for all NHS Staff.

rejection.details:
Staff facilities are a matter for individual NHS trusts, not the UK Government or Parliament. You could start a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding for NHS trusts to provide improved staff facilities, if that's what you'd like to happen.

You may wish to sign these petitions, calling for similar actions on pay and parking:

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073 

Pay rise for NHS and care staff
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313488 

Reward our healthcare heroes now for risking their lives to fight Covid-19. 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318741 

Give NHS staff a pay rise in line with MPs pay increase. 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313513 

Introduce a minimum starting wage of £40000 for all Nurses. 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315297 

Pay all NHS Staff at least the Real Living Wage
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310615

Allow free parking for all NHS employees on NHS property or their place of work.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312828
